metadata.title: USN-6738-1 -- LXD vulnerability
metadata.description: Fabian Bäumer, Marcus Brinkmann, and Jörg Schwenk discovered that LXD incorrectly handled the handshake phase and the use of sequence numbers in SSH Binary Packet Protocol (BPP). If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass integrity checks.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6738-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  golang-github-lxc-lxd-dev - 2.0.11-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm1 lxc2 - 2.0.11-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm1 lxd - 2.0.11-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm1 lxd-client - 2.0.11-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm1 lxd-tools - 2.0.11-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
